description: From Middle English howsoevere, how-so-evere, how so evere; equivalent to how +â€Ž soever.

adverbs.description: howsoever (formal or archaic, emphasised or embellished form of however in certain senses)

entries.meaning: Regardless of the way in which.
examples: Howsoever they pleaded, their pleas went unheard.
The party to this agreement may use the property whensoever and howsoever he or she pleases.
Their evidence, howsoever true it may have been, was not believed.
